meanings.definition: A person who imposes something, such as a tax or a burden.
meanings.sent1: The imposer of the new tax was not popular among the citizens.
meanings.sent2: The government official acted as the imposer of the regulations.
meanings.sent3: The imposer of chores on the children was met with groans and protests.
meanings.sent4: She was like an imposer of rules, strict and unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The imposer of the heavy workload made everyone feel overwhelmed.

meanings.definition: One who imposes oneself on others.
meanings.sent1: The party imposer always showed up uninvited.
meanings.sent2: He was known as the social imposer among his friends.
meanings.sent3: The imposer of unwanted advice never seemed to take a hint.
meanings.sent4: She was like an imposer of her presence, always making herself known.
meanings.sent5: The imposer of conversations never let anyone else speak.

meanings.definition: A person who forces someone to accept or endure something.
meanings.sent1: The bully was an imposer of fear on the other students.
meanings.sent2: She felt like an imposer of guilt on her friend.
meanings.sent3: The imposer of long meetings made everyone wish for a quicker end.
meanings.sent4: He was an imposer of strict deadlines, pushing everyone to work faster.
meanings.sent5: The imposer of strict rules made sure no one could bend them.
